skill.name: when-mapping-dependencies-use-dependency-mapper
skill.description: Comprehensive dependency mapping, analysis, and visualization tool for software projects
skill.summary: Comprehensive dependency mapping, analysis, and visualization tool for software projects
skill.author: Claude Code

security_audit.summary: Static analyzer flagged 261 patterns, but ALL major findings are FALSE_POSITIVES. The skill is a legitimate dependency analysis tool. External commands are coordination hooks for Claude-Flow. Network access queries vulnerability databases. Environment variables authenticate to security APIs. No malicious intent detected.

content.value_statement: Software projects often have hidden dependency issues that cause security vulnerabilities, build problems, and maintenance headaches. Dependency Mapper extracts complete dependency trees, detects circular dependencies, identifies outdated packages, and scans for security vulnerabilities across multiple package managers.
actual_capabilities: Extract complete dependency trees from package managers (npm, pip, cargo, maven, go)
Detect circular dependencies and duplicate packages in the dependency graph
Scan for security vulnerabilities using npm audit, Snyk, GitHub Advisories, and OSV
Generate interactive HTML and SVG dependency visualizations with D3.js
Check for outdated packages and suggest update priorities
Query multiple vulnerability databases in parallel for comprehensive security coverage
limitations: Requires lock files to be present for complete analysis (package-lock.json, yarn.lock, etc.)
Visualization for very large dependency trees may require limiting tree depth
Security scans require network access to vulnerability databases

use_cases.title: Pre-release security audits
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive vulnerability scans before deploying to production and generate security reports.

use_cases.title: CI/CD pipeline integration
use_cases.description: Automate dependency analysis in build pipelines to catch vulnerabilities before merge.

use_cases.title: Bundle optimization
use_cases.description: Identify duplicate dependencies and large packages that can be replaced with lighter alternatives.

prompt_templates.title: Visualize dependencies
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an interactive HTML visualization showing my dependency tree with vulnerable packages highlighted.

prompt_templates.title: Circular dependency check
prompt_templates.prompt: Detect all circular dependencies in my project and show the paths.

output_examples.input: Map dependencies in my project with security audit
output: Recommendation: Update lodash to fix high-severity CVE

best_practices: Run dependency mapping before major releases to catch security issues early
Integrate into CI/CD pipelines with automated failure on critical vulnerabilities
Use visualization to identify and resolve circular dependency issues
anti_patterns: Ignoring low-severity vulnerabilities that can accumulate over time
Using deep dependency trees without monitoring for circular dependencies
Skipping security scans to save time during fast-paced releases

faq.question: What package managers are supported?
faq.answer: npm, yarn, pnpm, pip, poetry, cargo, maven, go modules, bundler, composer, and nuget.

faq.question: How does security scanning work?
faq.answer: The tool queries npm audit, Snyk, GitHub Advisories, and OSV databases in parallel for comprehensive coverage.

faq.question: Can I use this offline?
faq.answer: Basic dependency extraction works offline, but security scanning requires network access to vulnerability databases.

faq.question: How is circular dependency detection performed?
faq.answer: Uses depth-first search algorithm to detect cycles in the dependency graph and reports paths.

faq.question: What visualization formats are available?
faq.answer: Console text summary, JSON report, interactive HTML with D3.js, and static SVG diagrams.

faq.question: How does caching work?
faq.answer: Results are cached for 1 hour using md5 hash of project path. Use --no-cache to skip cached results.
